news.title: Seven more die from malnutrition in Gaza, Hamas-run ministry says
news.summary: The Gaza health ministry says the figures for the last 24 hours take the overall toll of malnutrition deaths to 154 since 2023.

news.title: Freed British-Israeli hostage says Starmer 'risks rewarding terror' with Palestinian recognition
news.summary: Emily Damari says the prime minister is "not on the right side of history" with his plan for a Palestinian state.

news.title: Tsunami warning sparks evacuations in Japan and US after powerful Russia earthquake
news.summary: Tsunami waves have been reported across the Pacific following the 8.8 magnitude quake, but there are no initial reports of severe damage or injuries.

news.title: Why did Russian mega earthquake not cause more tsunami damage?
news.summary: The earthquake was one of the strongest ever recorded, but its tsunami was not as bad as feared.

news.title: Man guilty of Manchester Airport attack on police officers
news.summary: Mohammed Amaaz was seen attacking two female officers in footage shared widely on social media.

news.title: TikTok removes video by Huda Beauty boss over anti-Israel conspiracy theories
news.summary: Huda Kattan is accused of "using her massive platform to spread vile antisemitic conspiracy theories".

news.title: Family and fans give Ozzy Osbourne emotional send-off
news.summary: A tearful Sharon Osbourne accompanies Ozzy's coffin through Birmingham, watched by a large crowd.

news.title: Streeting invites doctors for fresh talks next week - but won't negotiate on pay
news.summary: But the health secretary says he will not negotiate on pay, adding that the union has lost goodwill with their five-day walkout.

news.title: BBC reunites with Met Office for weather forecasts
news.summary: After eight years apart, the BBC wants the Met Office to help provide "the most trusted" forecasts.

news.title: Major healthcare equipment firm on brink of failure
news.summary: NRS Healthcare, which provides wheelchairs, hoists and other equipment, is expected to run out of cash by the end of the week, the BBC understands.
